data.title: Who is Maria Taylor Husband? Everything About Maria Taylor
data.meta_description: Maria Taylor is married to Jonathan Lee Hemphill, a UK businessman and art dealer. They wed on February 12, 2021, and have one child together.
data.text:
Who is Maria Taylor's Husband?

Maria Taylor's husband is Jonathan Lee Hemphill. They got married on February 12, 2021. Jonathan is from the United Kingdom and works as a businessman and art dealer. He is the co-founder and president of Paddle, which is an online auction platform for art and luxury items. Jonathan also runs Squared Circles, a creative agency that collaborates with artists and brands.

Article continues below advertisement

Before marrying Jonathan, Maria was married to Rodney Blackstock. They were together from May 5, 2019, to 2021. Rodney is an agency owner at COUNTRY Financial. Maria and Jonathan have one child, a son named Roman Ryan Taylor Hemphill, who was born on December 24, 2023.

Source: Sportscaster

TRENDING

Who is Maria Taylor?

Maria Taylor is an American sports analyst and sportscaster born on May 12, 1987. She works for NBC Sports and has previously worked for ESPN and SEC Network. Maria covers various sports, including college football, college volleyball, the NBA, the NFL, and college basketball.

Article continues below advertisement

Article continues below advertisement

She started her career in sports journalism in 2009 with IMG College. At ESPN, she became well-known for her roles as a reporter and host, including on "NBA Countdown." In 2021, she joined NBC Sports, where she hosts "Football Night in America" and covers college football and tennis events.

Maria was a talented athlete in high school and college, playing both volleyball and basketball. She is 6 feet 2 inches tall. Maria is married to Jonathan Lee Hemphill, and they have a son named Roman Ryan Taylor Hemphill.

Article continues below advertisement

Maria Taylor Age

Maria Taylor was born on May 12, 1987. This makes her 37 years old as of 2024. She was born in Cookeville, Tennessee. Maria began her career in sports journalism in 2009 and has become a well-known sportscaster for NBC Sports, ESPN, and SEC Network.

Article continues below advertisement

Article continues below advertisement

Maria Taylor Career

Maria Taylor began her career in sports journalism in 2009, working for IMG College at the University of Georgia. She covered college sports and appeared on various shows. In 2013, she joined ESPN, where she became known for her work as a reporter and host on programs like "NBA Countdown" and college football coverage.

Article continues below advertisement

Article continues below advertisement

In 2014, Maria moved to SEC Network, covering college sports and hosting shows. She gained further recognition for her work during the College Football Playoff and NBA Finals. In 2021, Maria Taylor joined NBC Sports. She hosts "Football Night in America" and covers college football and tennis events. Her career has been marked by her versatility and expertise in sports broadcasting.

https://www.instagram.com/p/CxCFMqMtWGM/

Maria Taylor Net Worth

Maria Taylor's net worth is approximately $6 million. She has accumulated this wealth through her successful career as a sports analyst and reporter. Maria began her career in sports journalism in 2009, working with IMG College and later with ESPN. She gained significant recognition at ESPN and SEC Network before joining NBC Sports in 2021. Her roles have included covering major sports events such as college football, the NBA Finals, and the French Open.
